page.title: 16GOLDHANGER - BUILDINGS
page.content: Number 2 Fish Street, Goldhanger used to a bakers.One could tell because it had big windows made out of squares of glass.Number 4 Fish Street used to be a butchers which only sold one type of meat. Number 6 on were normal houses. Number 13 caught my eye because the garage was an unusual shape.Opposite was a brand new house which was faced with plaster and pargetted.In Fish Street there are some lovely cottages.They looked about 80 years old. The house was like a house that children draw with four windows a door in the middle you could tell it was old because some of the bricks were falling of the chimney. Below each window were window boxes full of flowers which made the house look like a typical olde worlde country cottage.
